page_analysis.text_content:
Accessory structures site planning

Note: Site planning for accessory buildings differs from that for parking structures in one way. A special allowance enables garages to be located in the rear/side yards even when the lot is not deep enough to maintain the 75' minimum distance from the front lot line. This does not apply to non-parking accessory structures.

Fig 24 Examples of site planning solutions for accessory structures

A Combo garage /small pool cabana
(side by side)

• Structure is located in rear yard so it must:
  a. be at least 75' from the front lot line
  b. be no more than 12' high
  c. comply with accessory-structure daylight
     plane. (Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32)
• Structure is located right at the side lot line so
  that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
• Structure has 2 plumbing fixtures.

B Stand-alone pool cabana

• Structure is located in rear yard so it must:
  a. be at least 75' from the front lot line
  b. be no more than 12' high
  c. comply with accessory-structure daylight
     plane. (Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32)
• Structure is located right at the rear lot line so
  that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
• Structure has 3 plumbing fixtures— sink,
  toilet, and shower and is greater than 200
  sf, so it requires a CUP.

C Office above garage

• Structure is located within the buildable
  area, so it doesn't have to comply with
  regulations for structures in the required
  yards and it may be two stories high.
• Structure has 2 plumbing fixtures.
• Structure is new 2nd floor addition and
  therefore subject to the Planning
  Department's Individual Review (IR).

visual_elements.description: Figure 24 is a composite diagram showing three different site plans for properties with accessory structures, labeled A, B, and C. Each diagram illustrates a specific zoning scenario described in the text above it.
visual_elements.location: Middle and bottom of the page

visual_elements.description: Diagram A, labeled 'Interior lot example', shows a property with a 'Main dwelling'. In the rear yard, a 'Combo garage / small pool house' (black box) and a small pool are depicted. The accessory structure is located on the side lot line. A dimension line indicates a 'Min. 75'' distance from the front lot line to the accessory structure. The diagram labels 'Front yard', 'Rear yard', and 'Interior-side yard'.

Diagram B, labeled 'Interior lot example', shows a property with a 'Main dwelling' that has a '2-car attached garage'. In the rear yard, a 'Larger pool cabana' (black box) and a pool are shown. The cabana is located on the rear lot line. A dimension line indicates a 'Min. 75'' distance from the front lot line to the accessory structure. The diagram labels 'Front yard', 'Rear yard', and two 'Interior-side yard' areas.

Diagram C, labeled 'Corner lot example', shows a corner property with a 'Main dwelling'. An 'Office above garage' (black box) is shown as part of the main building, located within the buildable area. A dimension line indicates a '3' min.' setback from the street-side lot line. The diagram labels 'Front yard', 'Rear yard', 'Interior-side yard', and 'Street-side yard'.

A 'Key' or legend in the bottom right corner defines the graphical elements used in the diagrams. It includes symbols for: Curb (thick solid line), Lot line (thin solid line), Sidewalk (tiled pattern), Required setbacks (dashed line), Buildable area (light gray shaded area with dashed border), Dwelling/parking (medium gray shaded area), and Accessory structure (black shaded area).

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum distance from front lot line
Maximum height for rear yard structure
Plumbing fixtures in office above garage

subheadings: Fig 24 Examples of site planning solutions for accessory structures
A Combo garage /small pool cabana (side by side)

additional_notes.description: A note in the top right corner, in a sans-serif font, explains a special allowance for garages regarding the 75' minimum distance from the front lot line.

A note with a callout arrow pointing to the 'Office above garage' in diagram C. The note, in a sans-serif font, states: 'Note: Because this structure is 2 stories, it must be locted within the buildable area regardless of the distances from the lot lines and is subject to Individual Review (IR)'. Note the typo 'locted' for 'located'.
additional_notes.location: Right side, pointing to diagram C

additional_notes.description: The page is numbered '31' at the bottom right corner.

The page is organized with a main title at the top, followed by a descriptive note and a figure caption. The main content is split into three columns (A, B, C) providing rules for different scenarios. Below the text, three corresponding diagrams visually represent these scenarios. A legend ('Key') is provided at the bottom right.
In diagram A, the label 'small poo house' is a likely OCR error for 'small pool house' given the context of the pool and the other cabana examples.

cross_references.location: Section C and side note for diagram C
